info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 18 at 8:30AM CDT until June 19 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Norman OK
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma...
Cottonwood Creek at Guthrie affecting Logan County.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Cottonwood Creek at Guthrie.
* WHEN...From this morning to early tomorrow afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Cottonwood Creek reaches bankfull levels or higher in a few places along the rural flood plain downstream to the Cimarron River.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. At 7:00 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was estimated at 8.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Forecast...The Cottonwood Creek is expected to rise to a crest of 20.2 feet just after midnight tonight. - Action stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON
